title: Coconut Rundown Fish
description: A rich, aromatic Caribbean-style fish simmered in a spiced reduced coconut milk sauce with bell pepper, tomato and fresh herbs. The fish stays moist while the rundown sauce concentrates sweet coconut, tangy tomato and warm spices for a vibrant, comforting main dish.

ingredients.display_name: firm white fish fillets (cod, snapper or halibut), about 2 cm thick
ingredients.notes: cut into 4 portions, pat dry, skin removed if desired

ingredients.display_name: scotch bonnet or habanero pepper, seeded and finely chopped
ingredients.notes: optional — adjust for heat or substitute jalapeño
adjust to taste; divide between sauce and fish

ingredients.display_name: fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish, chopped

steps.text: Prepare and season the fish: pat fillets dry, season both sides with half the salt and half the pepper, and set aside at room temperature while you prepare aromatics.
Heat oil in a large deep skillet or sauté pan over medium heat until shimmering; add sliced onion and cook until translucent and just beginning to brown, stirring occasionally.
Add minced garlic, chopped scotch bonnet (if using), sliced scallions and thyme; cook, stirring, until fragrant for about a minute so the aromatics release their oils.
Stir in diced tomato, julienned bell pepper, brown sugar and ground allspice; cook until the tomato breaks down and juices appear, about 4 minutes, stirring to deglaze the pan and combine flavors.

Pour in the canned coconut milk and water and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer; scrape any browned bits from the pan and let the liquid reduce uncovered until slightly thickened and glossy, about 8 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning with remaining salt and pepper.

Nestle the seasoned fish pieces into the simmering coconut rundown in a single layer, spoon some sauce over the tops, reduce heat to low, cover the pan partially and simmer gently until the fish is opaque and flakes easily, about 6–7 minutes depending on thickness.
Finish with fresh lime juice and gently stir in sliced scallion greens; remove from heat and let the fish rest in the sauce for 2 minutes to meld flavors.
Serve the coconut rundown fish hot, garnished with chopped cilantro or parsley and additional lime wedges alongside rice, fried dumplings, or plantains as desired.
